ratings.comment: The best professor out of the 345 "trio." She talks fast, but is kind and caring. Explains the concepts very clearly and very willing to answer questions. Exams for 345 are fair but obviously not going to be "easy." I would for sure take a class with her again and would pick her over the other 345 professors.

Ellison was the kind of professor who simply read off of the slides she was given in order to teach you and didn't even put in the effort to explain the chemistry behind reactions. She taught fast and expected you to keep up. If someone raised their hand during class she often didn't even look up and allow them to ask a question.

Very smart and very nice. I think she's the best lecturer out of the trio (her, Brian, and Ryan) but all of them are great choices as the trio really instills WHY reactions occur rather than memorization. She is also very approachable and will meet with students outside of her scheduled office hours. Bonus: she helps run 344 so there's crossover.

Take the Essleman/Ellison/Stowe trio so you are able to attend any of their or their TA's office hours; it will save your grade. They also keep you super updated what your curved grade is. 100% recommend Ellison specifically as she is very good at explaining the concepts of organic chemistry and never felt condescending when answering questions

Chem 343 is a really tough class for a lot of people and Professor Ellison does a great job making the material palatable. She is a really good lecturer, super kind, and very approachable. My biggest piece of advice is to take Chem 343 with one of the trio professors (Ellison, Esselman, and Stowe) and get Aubrey if you can, she's great
Ellison is a great professor. Ochem is super hard but she explains it well in my opinion.
I found Professor Ellison to be very accessible outside of class and very accommodating in this difficult time. She seems to care about her students and is a good lecturer.

For OChem this past semester, I found Ellison's large group discussions to be one of the most helpful sessions to go to. She is very good at answering everyone's questions and being thorough with a problem without confusing everyone (too much).

I think Ellison is a great teacher. She takes a hard class and really dives deep into concepts at a pretty reasonable pace. The material is definitely hard but that's because it's OCHEM, it's inevitable. While I still struggle, she makes it a lot easier. She's a great teacher and I'm appreciative of her teaching style.

Dr Ellison is the perfect lecturer for an introductory OChem class. Her well organized and straightforward lectures help students develop a clear initial understanding of the field of organic chemistry. She has realistic expectations toward her students and goes over the material with just enough detail to help students learn at a comfortable pace.

Dr. Ellison is a superhero. She taught 343 while being pregnant!!!! Super helpful and I owe my grade to her- she taught me to believe in myself and that I could do well in this class. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. 343 is a difficult class but if you put in the effort you will flourish like a tertiary carbocation (compared to a secondary carbocation.)

Good lecturer although take Esselman/Bowman over her if you can. All lectures posted online with plenty of resources available for studying. No homework! Only quizzes and exams. The grading criteria for the assessments can be specific but not unreasonable. Watch Youtube videos if there is a concept you do not understand!

Dr. Ellison is a bit less entertaining than some other professors but super nice and you can tell she wants you to succeed. Posts all lectures online, which was crucial for my studying. Obviously ochem is hard, but you can tell she's trying her best to make it not as unbearable.
Posts all lectures online.

Great professor. She moves very quickly sometimes, but that's just o chem. Lectures are clear and beneficial, but also posted online in case you can't make it or want to look back. Exams are pretty similar to practice exams and relatively straightforward, but grading criteria is very specific so sometimes grading is tough.

Although I've only had Ellison for less than a full semester, it is clear she is so amazing at communicating concepts and teaching material. I've had an easier time learning O chem than gen chem thanks to her. I would 10/10 recommend her. The only way you could do bad in this class is if you didn't do the work required. #ochemcanbefun
Really clear about what is needed to know fo the class. Use the resources she gives and you will feel prepared for the exams.

Last semester I took 343 with Gellman where I ultimately had to drop due to my inability to comprehend the material. This semester that completely changed. Dr. Ellison is an amazing lecturer and a real joy. I found myself actually enjoying myself when studying. 12/10 do recommend. She's definitely one of the best professors I've ever had.
Textbook isn't necessary- it will just confuse you. Everything you need to know is clearly explained in lecture and the problem sets. Get ready to use piazza.

I've honestly hated organic chemistry for most of my chemistry career. When I got into Professor Ellison's class, I was pleasantly surprised to see how interesting she makes the material. She explains things really clearly and genuinely wants to see her students succeed.

Class is graded only by exams/quizzes. Textbook isnt mandatory but if you want an A you should get it and the solution manual as theyre very helpful. Overall great lecturer who puts her slides and lecture videos online if you miss class or want to hear her explain things again
